conclusion: The question asks how shadows A, B, C, and D will change when the light source moves to the front right, away from the objects.
There are four objects above the slabs casting shadows labeled A, B, C, and D on the ground.
When the light source moves to the front right, it will be further away from the objects, resulting in smaller shadows.
The direction of the light source will change, causing the shadows to move to the left.
A, B, C, and D will all move to the left and become smaller.
